intro: Erodium aragonense, commonly known as Spanish catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Erodium aragonense is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
